closed_reason: Read cmd/ticker/main.go. Found 4 subcommands: (1) run [epic-id] - runs an epic with the AI agent, (2) resume <checkpoint-id> - resumes from a checkpoint, (3) checkpoints [epic-id] - lists available checkpoints, (4) upgrade - upgrades ticker to latest version. Root command 'ticker' also supports --version flag.
description: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and list all subcommands defined.

run.output:
I'll read the main.go file to list all CLI subcommands defined.Based on reading cmd/ticker/main.go, I can now list all the CLI subcommands. Let me close the task with the findings.Task completed. The CLI subcommands defined in cmd/ticker/main.go are:

1. **run [epic-id]** - Run an epic with the AI agent. Flags: `--max-iterations/-n`, `--max-cost`, `--checkpoint-interval`, `--max-task-retries`, `--auto`, `--headless`
2. **resume <checkpoint-id>** - Resume from a saved checkpoint
3. **checkpoints [epic-id]** - List available checkpoints (optionally filtered by epic)
4. **upgrade** - Upgrade ticker to the latest version

The root command `ticker` also supports the standard `--version` flag.

title: List CLI commands
